file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 33-50-07-04 - OVERWING EMERGENCY LIGHT - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL OVERWING EMERGENCY LIGHT - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the overwing emergency-light lamp and the overwing emergency-light assembly. B. There are two overwing emergency lights installed on the aircraft. They are installed on the PSU panel, over the passenger-cabin escape hatches (overwing emergency door). The removal/ installation procedures of this section are the same for the two lights. C. The overwing emergency light illuminates the overwing exit areas in an emergency condition. D. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY OVERWING EMERGENCY-LIGHT LAMP - ALL 33-50-07-000-801-A REMOVAL OVERWING EMERGENCY-LIGHT LAMP - ALL 33-50-07-400-801-A INSTALLATION OVERWING EMERGENCY-LIGHT ASSEM- ALL 33-50-07-000-802-A BLY - REMOVAL OVERWING EMERGENCY-LIGHT ASSEM- ALL 33-50-07-400-802-A BLY - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 33-50-07 Page 1 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-50-07-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. OVERWING EMERGENCY-LIGHT LAMP - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the overwing emergency-light lamp. B. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 251 Passenger Cabin (PSU panel) 252 Passenger Cabin (PSU panel) C. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable D. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable E. Consumable Materials Not Applicable F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin (PSU panels) H. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the EMERG circuit breaker and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to it (Location Tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2/LIGHTS/EMERG). I. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Carefully remove the lens (2). (2) Remove the lamp (3) from the light housing assembly (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-50-07 Page 2 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Overwing Emergency-Light Lamp - Removal/Installation Figure 401 B A ZONES 251 252 PSU PANEL (REF.) DET. A 1. LIGHT HOUSING 3. LAMP ASSEMBLY 2. LENS DET. B 145AMM330183.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-50-07 Page 3 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-50-07-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. OVERWING EMERGENCY-LIGHT LAMP - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the overwing emergency-light lamp. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 33-50-00-700-801-A/500 EMERGENCY LIGHTS - OPERATIONAL CHECK C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 251 Passenger Cabin (PSU panel) 252 Passenger Cabin (PSU panel) D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin (PSU panels) I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Install the lamp (3) in the light housing assembly (1). (2) Carefully install the lens (2). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, close the EMERG circuit breaker and remove the DO- NOT-CLOSE tag from it (Location Tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2/LIGHTS/EMERG). (2) Do the Emergency Lighting test ( AMM TASK 33-50-00-700-801-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 33-50-07 Page 4 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-50-07-000-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 4. OVERWING EMERGENCY-LIGHT ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the overwing emergency-light assembly. B. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 251 Passenger Cabin (PSU panel) 252 Passenger Cabin (PSU panel) C. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable D. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable E. Consumable Materials Not Applicable F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin (PSU panels) H. Preparation SUBTASK 841-003-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the EMERG circuit breaker and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to it (Location Tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2/LIGHTS/EMERG). I. Removal (Figure 402) SUBTASK 020-003-A (1) Carefully remove the lens (2). (2) Remove the screws (3). (3) Carefully pull the light housing assembly (1) from the headliner panel. (4) Remove the screws (6) and washers (5) and (4) that attach the terminal lugs (7) to the light housing assembly (1). (5) Remove the light housing assembly (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 33-50-07 Page 5 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Overwing Emergency-Light Assembly - Removal/Installation Figure 402 B A ZONES 251 252 PSU PANEL (REF.) DET. A 7. TERMINAL LUG (2) 6. SCREW (2) 1. LIGHT HOUSING ASSEMBLY 5. WASHER (2 ) 3. SCREW (4) 4. WASHER (2) 2. LENS DET. B 145AMM330182.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 33-50-07 Page 6 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-50-07-400-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 5. OVERWING EMERGENCY-LIGHT ASSEMBLY - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the overwing emergency-light assembly. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 33-50-00-700-801-A/500 EMERGENCY LIGHTS - OPERATIONAL CHECK C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 251 Passenger Cabin (PSU panel) 252 Passenger Cabin (PSU panel) D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin (PSU panels) I. Installation (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-003-A (1) Install the screws (6) and washers (5) and (4) to attach the terminal lugs (7) to the light housing assembly (1). (2) Carefully put the light housing assembly (1) in its installation position. (3) Install the screws (3). (4) Carefully install the lens (2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 33-50-07 Page 7 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-003-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, close the EMERG circuit breaker and remove the DO- NOT-CLOSE tag from it (Location Tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2/LIGHTS/EMERG). (2) Do the Emergency Lighting test ( AMM TASK 33-50-00-700-801-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 33-50-07 Page 8 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A.
